rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment factually reports the location of cases without using high-potency language.
The segment uses plain verbs ('were') and does not pair them with significant scale or impact details.
The segment does not contain any questions.
This segment reports the location of cases but contains no explicit calming language or cues.
The segment does not contain a minimiser token ('only', 'just', etc.) combined with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes the location of cases, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment reports the location of cases, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics in the sense of Q9.
The segment reports the location of recent cases but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
Segment contains no direct quotes or attributed statements from a source.
Factual reporting of case locations using neutral, descriptive language. No explicit framing cues present.
